slides.content:
# Business Dashboards ğŸ“Š

Visual displays of key information.

## What is a Dashboard?

A visual display of the most important information needed to achieve objectives, consolidated on a single screen for monitoring at-a-glance.

## Types of Dashboards

| Type | Purpose | Audience |
|------|---------|----------|
| Strategic | High-level trends | Executives |
| Operational | Daily monitoring | Managers |
| Analytical | Deep exploration | Analysts |

## Key Elements

- KPIs and metrics
- Charts and graphs
- Filters and drill-downs
- Alerts and thresholds

> ğŸ’¡ A dashboard should answer questions at a glance!

slides.title: Dashboard Design Principles
slides.content:
# Dashboard Design Principles ğŸ¨

## 1. Know Your Audience
- What decisions do they make?
- What information do they need?

## 2. Less is More
- 5-7 visualizations maximum
- Remove unnecessary elements
- Focus on key metrics

## 3. Layout Matters
- Important items top-left
- Logical flow of information
- Group related metrics

## 4. Use Right Charts

| Data Type | Best Chart |
|-----------|------------|
| Trends | Line chart |
| Comparison | Bar chart |
| Composition | Pie/stacked bar |
| Relationship | Scatter plot |

## 5. Color with Purpose
- Consistent color scheme
- Red/green for good/bad
- Highlight key data

slides.title: Design Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Where should the most important information be placed on a dashboard?

slides.title: Common Dashboard Mistakes
slides.content:
# Common Dashboard Mistakes âŒ

## 1. Too Much Information
- Overwhelming users
- Key insights get lost

## 2. Wrong Chart Types
- 3D charts
- Pie charts with many slices

## 3. Poor Color Choices
- Too many colors
- Not accessible

## 4. No Context
- Missing targets/benchmarks
- No time comparisons

## 5. Static Data
- Not refreshed regularly
- No drill-down capability

## 6. No Clear Purpose
- What question does this answer?
- Who will use this?

> ğŸ¯ **Rule:** Every element should serve a purpose!

| Factor | Consider |

| Users | Self-service needs |
| Ecosystem | Existing tools |

slides.title: Building a Dashboard
slides.content:
# Building a Dashboard ğŸ”§

## Step 1: Define Requirements
- Who is the audience?
- What questions to answer?
- What decisions to support?

## Step 2: Identify KPIs
- 5-7 key metrics
- Leading and lagging
- Clear targets

## Step 3: Plan Layout
- Sketch wireframe first
- Group related metrics
- Consider flow

## Step 4: Choose Visualizations
- Right chart for data
- Consistent styling
- Clear labels

## Step 5: Build and Test
- Iterate with users
- Check data accuracy
- Test performance

## Step 6: Deploy and Maintain
- Set refresh schedule
- Gather feedback
- Update as needed
